classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as short-chain keto acids and derivatives. These are keto acids with an alkyl chain the contains less than 6 carbon atoms.

pathway.name: Methylmalonic Aciduria Due to Cobalamin-Related Disorders
Homocystinuria-Megaloblastic Anemia Due to Defect in Cobalamin Metabolism, cblG Complementation Type

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: Methylmalonyl-CoA carboxyltransferase 5S subunit
polypeptide.specific-function: The 5S subunit specifically catalyzes the transfer of the carboxyl group from biotin of the 1.3S subunit to pyruvate to form oxaloacetate and 1.3S biotin.

article.citation: Overington JP, Al-Lazikani B, Hopkins AL: How many drug targets are there? Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Dec;5(12):993-6.
Imming P, Sinning C, Meyer A: Drugs, their targets and the nature and number of drug targets. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2006 Oct;5(10):821-34.

polypeptide.name: 1-aminocyclopropane-1-carboxylate deaminase
polypeptide.specific-function: Catalyzes a cyclopropane ring-opening reaction, the irreversible conversion of 1-aminocyclopropane-1-carboxylate (ACC) to ammonia and alpha-ketobutyrate. Allows growth on ACC as a nitrogen source.
